result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexis J Cruz Montanez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alexis J Cruz Montanez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alexis J Cruz Montanez was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Alexis J Cruz Montanez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sent to the defendant advising the Court has reviewed and denied the request.
From defendant requesting Huber privileges.  Court has reviewed and denied the request.

Defendant Alexis J Cruz Montanez in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald J Sonderhouse.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 2 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Ct.  4 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- 9 months jail straight time concurrent to Ct. 3 STAYED for 1 year Probation -  consecutive to present sentence
- Fine totaling $631.00 to be paid as a condition of probation; alternate 13 days jail - consecutive
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety- no alcohol/drugs.  Submit to a formal AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow any recommendations by the Agent. 

Ct. 3;
- 90 days jail concurrent to Ct. 2 - consecutive to present sentence defendant is serving
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a condition of Probation on Ct. 2; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive

Defendant Alexis J Cruz Montanez in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald J Sonderhouse.   Kevin M Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Sonderhouse states he has not received discovery and requests another date. State advises discovery was mailed to Atty. Sonderhouse. Court will give another date.  Hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexis J Cruz Montanez in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald J. Sonderhouse.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss count 1. Court grants and count 1 is dismissed.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
